meanings.definition: Lack of agreement or harmony; inconsistency.
meanings.sent1: The inconformity between their stories raised suspicions.
meanings.sent2: The inconformity in their opinions led to a heated debate.
meanings.sent3: The inconformity in their fashion choices made them stand out.
meanings.sent4: The inconformity in their personalities created a colorful dynamic.
meanings.sent5: The inconformity in the puzzle pieces made it challenging to complete.

meanings.sent1: Her inconformity to the dress code resulted in a warning.
meanings.sent2: His inconformity with the rules made him a rebel in the group.
meanings.sent3: The inconformity of the cat trying to bark amused the children.
meanings.sent4: The inconformity of the flower growing in the desert was striking.
meanings.sent5: The inconformity of the student's behavior made him memorable to the teacher.
